title: Institutes a moratorium on issuance of licenses for establishments where fowls are slaughtered
summary: Institutes a moratorium on issuance of licenses for establishments where fowls are slaughtered in cities of one million or more.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2829

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 20, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  CLARK,  BRENNAN,  PHEFFER,  JACOBS, MILLMAN,
         P. RIVERA, LANCMAN, TITUS, SCARBOROUGH -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M.  of
         A.  BOYLAND,  COOK,  GABRYSZAK,  GOTTFRIED,  HIKIND,  LENTOL,  MAISEL,
         MARKEY, MAYERSOHN, ROBINSON,  TITONE,  WEISENBERG  --  read  once  and
         referred to the Committee on Agriculture

       AN  ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law, in relation to licens-
         ing of establishments where fowls are slaughtered; and  providing  for
         the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Article 5-A of the agriculture and markets law  is  amended
    2  by adding a new section 96-aa to read as follows:
    3    S  96-AA. MORATORIUM ON LICENSES. THE LEGISLATURE HAS FOUND THAT THERE
    4  ARE PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY CONCERNS SUCH AS AVIAN INFLUENZA ASSOCIATED
    5  WITH  ESTABLISHMENTS  THAT  SLAUGHTER  AND  PROCESS  FOWLS  ON-SITE  AND
    6  FURTHERMORE  THAT  AREAS HEAVILY POPULATED WITH RESIDENCES ARE NOT SUIT-
    7  ABLE LOCATIONS FOR SITING SUCH BUSINESSES. THE  COMMISSIONER  IS  HEREBY
    8  DIRECTED  TO  INSTITUTE A MORATORIUM ON THE ISSUANCE OF LICENSES TO LIVE
    9  POULTRY MARKETS PURSUANT TO SECTION  NINETY-SIX-B  OF  THIS  ARTICLE  IN
   10  CITIES  OF ONE MILLION OR MORE.  DURING SUCH MORATORIUM THE COMMISSIONER
   11  SHALL DIRECT A STUDY TO BE MADE REGARDING THE AFORESAID ISSUES IN  ORDER
   12  TO PREPARE NEW OR REVISE THE OLD REGULATIONS REGARDING THE LICENSING AND
   13  OPERATION  OF  SUCH ESTABLISHMENTS. ANY PARTY OR PERSON AGGRIEVED BY THE
   14  MORATORIUM MAY APPEAL TO THE COMMISSIONER WHO MAY GRANT ANY RELIEF HE OR
   15  SHE FEELS JUSTIFIED.
   16    S 2. This act shall take effect July 1, 2011 and shall expire  and  be
   17  deemed repealed July 1, 2012.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06584-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law, in relation to licensing of establishments where fowls are slaughtered; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof
